intro: Sweetia subelegans, commonly known as the slender sweetia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Sweetia subelegans is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and unique floral structure.
